alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 14 at 1:58PM CST until December 14 at 2:45PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Sumter County in west central Alabama... * Until 245 PM CST. * At 158 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Alamucha, or 11 miles east of Meridian, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Livingston, York, Cuba, Epes, Emelle, Bluffport, Boyd, The University Of West Alabama, Old Mallard Airport, I 20 Welcome Center At Cuba, Payneville and Sumterville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
